Text:
Even if we aren't bound, without magic there's just
no hope...

Rose observes the men in black with her
honey-colored eyes.
Still, even if our magic did work...

Their captors are few in number but too skilled to
take lightly in a one-on-one fight.

Thankfully, there has been no sign of Rex for some
time.

One can hope the knights outside have dealt with him,
but it is unlikely someone of his ability can be caught
off-guard.

It is Rose's earnest desire to do something before
Rex returns.

Rex still hasn't returned yet... What is that fool
doing?!
Rose...
There's no point in acting now.

As things stand, we can't defend against swords, let
alone bullets.

That, and the magic I sense from that man is on
another level. Even if we were to recover our own,
I'm not sure we could take him...
But if we just sit here, we'll be—
I know that...!

Based on his strong magic and how he carries himself,
the strength of this "Sir Gaunt" likely exceeds that
of an adept...or perhaps even the likes of Iris
Midgar...
Hopefully that is not the case.

But if it were, Rose's chances of besting Sir Gaunt
are slim to none, with or without magic.

Regardless, it is not yet the time to act. If only
it weren't also true that time is running out.

Rose can feel the magic draining from her body with
each passing minute.

This likely has something to do with the phenomenon
keeping her from using it, but the exact reason
is still unknown.

Though Rose herself is still fine for now, the
conditions of those students with less magic
are beginning to worsen.

In a few more hours, some will likely be suffering
the effects of magic deficiency, dooming any chances
they have of fighting back.
Rose's heart swells with anxiety and impatience.

The only thing keeping these emotions in check
throughout all this is the image of a boy.

Each time Rose thinks of Cid bravely sacrificing
himself to save her, something hot fills her chest.

Rose swore she would not let his valor be in vain. 
And so she bides her time, praying for the right
moment to arrive.

Sherry quietly takes in the situation from an air
vent.
Many students are seated in the auditorium.

However, there are also several students who have
been shot, perhaps for resisting their black-clad
assailants.

Sherry moves away from the vent and pulls out the
control device.

When she touches the device's red stone, a gold light
and symbols shine forth from it.

Sherry grips the shining controller tightly, then
flings it from the vent into the auditorium without a
second thought.
Foster Father... Hold on a little longer...!
The moment has abruptly arrived.

Out of nowhere, a dazzling light illuminates the
auditorium.
Agh!
Wh-What the?!
Wh-What's going on...?!

No one knows what is happening. But, Rose springs
into action before she can think.

It doesn't matter what that flash was. Her instincts
simply tell her that this is their last chance.

While everyone else is still overcome with surprise,
Rose dashes toward the nearest man in black.

And the moment she strikes at his unguarded head,
she realizes something—
(I can use magic!)
Her kick severs the man's head in the blink of an eye.
Gagh...!

She doesn't know why she can use magic again, but
that is the least important matter here.

Rose snatches the sword from the hip of the now-
headless man, thrusts it into the air, and shouts for
all to hear.
We've got our magic back!
Everyone, rise! This is our time to fight back!
Victory is the only option.

Rose is aware that, in this moment, she is now
the symbol of their uprising. As long as she
keeps fighting, so will everyone else. She
has to show them that they can win this.

Rose swings her sword with all her might, not sparing
a thought toward how she distributes her magic.
Yaaaaaaah!!!
The auditorium bursts into an uproar.

The students' wills are one, their fervor such that
it causes the very air to tremble.
Follow Rose!!!
Take their swords!
Wha?!
Dammit!
What are you doing? Kill them.
Aye!

Sir Gaunt looks intently at the control unit where
it lays on the floor, still glowing faintly.

Nu observes all these events from a corner of the
auditorium.

One figure is the focal point of all the attention,
the animosity, the cheers. A figure that felled many
foes, freed many students, and kept up the fight.

This figure inspires her comrades to follow in her
wake. And yet hers is a heedless charge that ignores
the allocation of her magic.

Vast though they may have been, Rose's magic reserves
have been draining steadily, and she is now near her limit.
*huff, huff*

I haven't recovered the magic I lost. That's why,
while my strength still holds...
...I must stop him!
Urk...!

She is close, almost there... But then, contrary to
her hopes, Rose finds herself surrounded.

Just one more foe... Rose realizes this is all she
has left in her.
I guess this is it...

No, even if I fall here, everyone will keep up
the fight...

The students' zeal consumes the auditorium. Even if
Rose dies, there will be no stopping them now.
Just as I kept up his...!

The boy's will had passed to Rose, and now hers will
pass to everyone else. Here, amidst the many lives
that were lost, it shall be carried on.

None of it will be in vain. Not the boy's death nor
Rose's own impending demise.

There is a reason why she, someone from a kingdom of
the arts, chose the sword. It was honestly a stupid
childhood dream, one that she had never spoken of to
anyone. And yet she had pursued it all the same.

Rose wonders if she has come just a little bit closer
to achieving this dream as she swings her sword for
the final time.

There is almost no magic put into the blow.
No strength, no speed.

However, the stroke of the sword is more beautiful
than any she has ever made before as it claims its
target's head.

It is the greatest satisfaction of Rose's life. She
feels as though she has seized upon some pivotal
realization.
But...

It is a shame that it has only come to her here at
the very end.

As she watches the blades descending on her from all
sides, Rose wishes that she could have lived just one
more day.
And then—
Her wish is granted.
A jet-black whirlwind tears onto the scene.

In mere seconds, all of the men around her are
annihilated.

A silence descends upon the area as if time itself
has stopped.

In the center of the cleared area now stands a man
in an ebony longcoat.
Astounding. You who possess such beautiful swordplay.

He speaks to Rose with a voice that seems to come
straight from the abyss.

He is likely speaking of her swordsmanship moments
ago. But Rose herself is so shocked she can not put
it into words.

The next thing she knows, a group of figures dressed
in black are standing along the upper level of the hall.
You're...
We are the Shadow Garden.
We lurk in the darkness and hunt down shadows...

At the signal of Shadow's sword, the black-clad group
leaps into action in unison.
